question: [File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Function: set_active_data_streams()] [Integer overflow] Can an attacker trigger state sync operations that cause the usize to i64 conversion to overflow when setting active data streams, potentially wrapping to negative values and causing metric inconsistencies that mislead operators about system health? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Function: set_max_concurrent_requests()] [Integer overflow] If a malicious validator sends an extremely large u64 value (>i64::MAX) for concurrent requests, can the cast to i64 wrap to negative values, causing the monitoring system to report incorrect negative concurrency levels and hiding actual resource exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Function: set_complete_pending_data_responses()] [Integer overflow] Can an attacker manipulate the data streaming protocol to trigger u64 values exceeding i64::MAX for complete pending responses, causing metric wrapping that hides actual pending response counts and prevents detection of data streaming stalls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Function: set_pending_data_responses()] [Integer overflow] If the number of pending data responses exceeds i64::MAX due to a Byzantine validator flooding the system with requests, can the negative wrapped value cause operators to incorrectly believe the system is healthy when it's actually experiencing resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Function: set_subscription_stream_lag()] [Integer overflow] Can a malicious validator cause the subscription stream lag to exceed i64::MAX versions, leading to a negative wrapped value in metrics that hides massive synchronization lag and prevents timely detection of state sync failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Function: observe_values()] [Integer overflow] When observing data chunk sizes, can an attacker send data responses with u64 values exceeding the maximum f64 precision (2^53), causing precision loss in histogram observations that distorts performance metrics and hides abnormally large data chunks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: ACTIVE_DATA_STREAMS] [Panic vulnerability] If the metric registry initialization fails during node startup (e.g., due to corrupted registry state), can the unwrap() call panic and crash the validator node, causing loss of liveness and preventing the node from participating in consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: DATA_STREAM_SEND_FAILURE] [Panic vulnerability] Can metric registration failure due to duplicate metric names or registry corruption cause the unwrap() to panic during runtime, crashing the data streaming service and preventing state synchronization across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: CREATE_DATA_STREAM] [Panic vulnerability] If a Byzantine validator triggers conditions that cause metric registration to fail (e.g., resource exhaustion in the metrics system), can the unwrap() panic and bring down the entire data streaming service, halting state sync and causing network-wide synchronization failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: CREATE_SUBSCRIPTION_STREAM] [Panic vulnerability] During epoch transitions when multiple subscription streams are created simultaneously, can concurrent metric registration failures cause unwrap() panics that crash validator nodes and disrupt the network's ability to synchronize state during critical reconfiguration events? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: TERMINATE_DATA_STREAM] [Panic vulnerability] Can an attacker trigger metric system resource exhaustion that causes the IntCounterVec registration to fail, leading to unwrap() panics when data streams are terminated, preventing proper cleanup and causing memory leaks in the state sync service? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: TERMINATE_SUBSCRIPTION_STREAM] [Panic vulnerability] If the metrics registry becomes corrupted or exhausted during heavy state sync load, can the unwrap() call panic when terminating subscription streams, leaving orphaned streams that consume resources and eventually cause validator crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: CHECK_STREAM_PROGRESS_ERROR] [Panic vulnerability] Can a Byzantine validator trigger conditions that cause the error tracking metric registration to fail, leading to unwrap() panics that prevent proper error handling and cause cascading failures in the state sync error recovery mechanisms? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: GLOBAL_DATA_SUMMARY_ERROR] [Panic vulnerability] During network-wide state sync operations, can simultaneous metric registration failures across multiple validators cause unwrap() panics that prevent error tracking and lead to undetected state inconsistencies across the network? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: SENT_DATA_REQUESTS] [Panic vulnerability] If the metrics system fails to initialize due to configuration errors or resource limits, can the unwrap() panic when tracking sent data requests, preventing validators from monitoring their outbound request patterns and detecting potential Byzantine behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: SENT_DATA_REQUESTS_FOR_MISSING_DATA] [Panic vulnerability] Can metric registration failure during critical data recovery operations cause unwrap() panics that prevent tracking of missing data requests, leading to undetected data gaps and potential state divergence across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: RETRIED_DATA_REQUESTS] [Panic vulnerability] If the histogram registration with multiple labels fails due to metric system limitations, can the unwrap() panic during request retry operations, preventing proper retry logic execution and causing permanent data synchronization failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: MAX_CONCURRENT_PREFETCHING_REQUESTS] [Panic vulnerability] Can resource exhaustion in the metrics registry cause the gauge registration to fail and unwrap() to panic, preventing the system from tracking concurrent prefetching limits and allowing unbounded prefetching that exhausts validator memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: PENDING_DATA_RESPONSES] [Panic vulnerability] During high-load scenarios with thousands of pending responses, can metric system failures cause unwrap() panics that prevent tracking of pending responses, leading to memory exhaustion as responses accumulate without monitoring? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: COMPLETE_PENDING_DATA_RESPONSES] [Panic vulnerability] If metric registration fails when tracking complete responses, can the unwrap() panic prevent proper response completion tracking, causing the system to leak memory by never cleaning up completed responses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: RECEIVED_DATA_RESPONSE] [Panic vulnerability] Can Byzantine validators trigger metric system failures that cause unwrap() panics when receiving data responses, preventing response processing and causing validators to fall behind in state synchronization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: RECEIVED_DATA_RESPONSE_CHUNK_SIZE] [Panic vulnerability] If the histogram registration with custom buckets fails due to invalid bucket configuration or metric system limits, can the unwrap() panic prevent chunk size tracking and allow Byzantine validators to send arbitrarily large chunks without detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: RECEIVED_RESPONSE_ERROR] [Panic vulnerability] Can error tracking metric registration failures cause unwrap() panics that prevent proper error handling, leading to cascading failures as errors go untracked and unhandled in the state sync pipeline? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: SUBSCRIPTION_STREAM_LAG] [Panic vulnerability] If the gauge registration fails during subscription stream operations, can the unwrap() panic prevent lag tracking and allow validators to fall arbitrarily far behind without detection, eventually causing network fragmentation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/metrics.rs] [Metric: DATA_REQUEST_PROCESSING_LATENCY] [Panic vulnerability] Can histogram registration with custom network latency buckets fail and cause unwrap() panics that prevent latency tracking, allowing Byzantine validators to introduce arbitrary delays without detection? (Medium)
